q: Which tram goes to RMIT City Campus?
a: Routes 19, 59, and 57 stop near RMIT Melbourne City Campus.

q: How do I buy a Myki card?
a: You can buy a Myki at 7-Eleven stores, station ticket offices, or online via PTV.

q: What time does the last tram run?
a: Most trams stop around midnight, but some Night Network services run on weekends.

q: Can I use the same Myki card on trains and buses?
a: Yes, a Myki card works on trains, trams, and buses across Melbourne.

q: Do trams in Melbourne have conductors?
a: No, Melbourne trams do not have conductors. You must touch on with Myki before boarding.

q: Is tram travel free in Melbourne CBD?
a: Yes, travel within the Free Tram Zone in Melbourne CBD is free and does not require a Myki.

q: Where can I check tram timetables?
a: You can check tram timetables on the PTV website or the PTV mobile app.

q: How often do trams run during peak hours?
a: During peak hours, most tram routes run every 6 to 12 minutes.

q: What happens if I forget to touch off?
a: On trams you only need to touch on. There is no need to touch off unless your trip ends in Zone 2.
